next_steps.note: "Research and select 3-5 poets whose style resonates with your vision for this project. Note key stylistic elements to potentially emulate or contrast.",
"Write a first draft of at least one poem, focusing on free verse and experimentation with imagery. Add this to 'Progress' when complete.",
"Choose a visual artwork (painting, sculpture, photograph) to serve as inspiration for an ekphrastic poem. Spend at least 30 minutes studying the artwork before beginning to write.",
"Gather images, colors, and textures that evoke the desired tone and themes of your poetry project. Create a digital or physical mood board with at least 5 visual elements.",
"Find a week-long poetry prompt challenge online (e.g., on Instagram, Reddit, or a dedicated poetry website) and commit to completing one prompt each day.",
"Select a poem by a favorite poet and record yourself reading it aloud.  Pay close attention to pacing, rhythm, and emphasis, and write down 3 specific observations about the performance.",
"Choose a constraint (e.g., only using 3-letter words, avoiding adjectives) and write a short poem (at least 8 lines) adhering to that rule."

ideas.note: "Explore ekphrastic poetry â€“ write a poem inspired by a visual artwork (painting, sculpture, photograph). This combines visual and literary creativity.",
"Create a 'mood board' for the project using images, colors, and textures that reflect the desired tone and themes of the poetry. This can inform imagery and stylistic choices.",
"Participate in a poetry prompt challenge (online or self-created) for one week. This forces daily writing and experimentation.",
"Record yourself reading a favorite poem (by another author) and analyze the cadence, rhythm, and vocal delivery. Use this analysis to inform your own writing and potential performance.",
"Experiment with constraints: write a poem using only words of a certain length, or limiting the use of specific parts of speech. This can unlock unexpected creative solutions."
